dialog: Hello Medi, I have a question about mental disorders.

Can you explain what somatoform disorders are?
Somatoform disorders are diagnosed when there are physical problems believed to be manifestations of a mental disorder.
Are there specific examples of somatoform disorders?
Yes, examples include somatization disorder and conversion disorder.
What about disorders of body perception?
Disorders of body perception include body dysmorphic disorder, where a person has a distorted view of their body.
I see. How are these disorders diagnosed?
knowledge: Mental illness Mental illness Some examples include autism spectrum disorder, oppositional defiant disorder and conduct disorder, and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, which may continue into adulthood. Conduct disorder, if continuing into adulthood, may be diagnosed as antisocial personality disorder. Popular labels such as psychopath do not appear in the DSM or ICD but are linked by some to these diagnoses. Somatoform disorders may be diagnosed when there are problems that appear to originate in the body that are thought to be manifestations of a mental disorder. This includes somatization disorder and conversion disorder. There are also disorders of how a person perceives their body, such as body dysmorphic disorder. Neurasthenia is an old diagnosis involving somatic complaints as well as fatigue and low spirits/depression, which is officially recognized by the ICD-10 but no longer by the DSM-IV Mental illness Mental illness
response: Somatoform disorders are diagnosed when there are physical problems believed to be manifestations of a mental disorder. Examples include somatization disorder and conversion disorder. Disorders of body perception include body dysmorphic disorder.
